title.div: The National Health Service (General Dental Services) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2001 / Rheoliadau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol (Gwasanaethau Deintyddol Cyffredinol) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2001

div.p: These Regulations further amend the National Health Service (General Dental Services) Regulations 1992 (S.I.1992/661) (“the principal Regulations”) which regulate the terms upon which general dental services are provided under the National Health Service Act 1977.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio ymhellach ar Reoliadau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol (Gwasanaethau Deintyddol Cyffredinol) 1992 (O.S. 1992/661) (“y prif Reoliadau”) sy'n rheoli ar ba delerau y mae gwasanaethau deintyddol cyffredinol yn cael eu darparu o dan Ddeddf y Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol 1977.

entry.title: The Crofting Community Development Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations introduce measures to supplement–

entry.title: The Water Supply (Water Quality) (Scotland) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations supplement Part VIA of the Water (Scotland) Act 1980 (“the 1980 Act”); amend, for a limited period, the Water Supply (Water Quality) (Scotland) Regulations 1990 (“the 1990 Regulations”) and, on 25th December 2003, revoke and replace those Regulations. They are primarily concerned with the quality of water supplied in Scotland for drinking, washing, cooking and food preparation, and for food production, and with arrangements for the publication of information about water quality.

entry.title: The A421 (M1 Junction 13 Roundabout, Husborne Crawley, Bedfordshire) (Trunking) Order 2001
entry.summary: This version of the The A421 (M1 Junction 13 Roundabout, Husborne Crawley, Bedfordshire) (Trunking) Order 2001 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The A428 Trunk Road (Northampton To East Of Bedford) (Detrunking) Order 2001
entry.summary: This version of the The A428 Trunk Road (Northampton To East Of Bedford) (Detrunking) Order 2001 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The A43 Trunk Road (M1 Junction 15A to A16 Stamford) (Detrunking) Order 2001
entry.summary: This version of the The A43 Trunk Road (M1 Junction 15A to A16 Stamford) (Detrunking) Order 2001 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Scotland) Declaratory (No. 5) Amendment (No. 3) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order reduces the infected area declared by the Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Scotland) Declaratory (No. 5) Order 2001 and subject to the restrictions therein.

entry.title: The School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (Amendment of Schedule 18) (England) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order amends Schedule 18 to the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 in so far as it applies to England.

entry.title: The Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Scotland) (Declaratory and Controlled Area) Amendment (No. 6) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order further amends the Foot-and-Mouth Disease Declaratory (Controlled Area) (Scotland) (No. 3) Order 2001.

entry.title: The Plant Protection Products Amendment (No. 2) (Scotland) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Plant Protection Products Regulations 1995 (“the 1995 Regulations”), which implement Council Directive 91/414/EEC concerning the placing of plant protection products on the market (O.J. No. L 230, 19.8.91, p.1, as read with corrigenda published in O.J. No. L 170, 25.6.92, p.40).

entry.title: Departments (Transfer of Functions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: This Order transfers certain functions of Northern Ireland departments and Ministers to other such departments and Ministers.

entry.title: The Farm Business Development (Scotland) Scheme 2001
entry.summary: This instrument establishes the Farm Business Development (Scotland) Scheme (“the Scheme”) for that part of Scotland outwith the Highlands and Islands area (see definition of “scheme area”). It enables the payment of financial assistance under the Scheme for measures which are listed in Parts I and II of the Schedule to the Scheme. These are capital measures by creating new or improving existing diversified agricultural activities and diversification outwith agricultural activities to provide alternative sources of income. They include support for training and marketing. Any of these measures can also be undertaken as collaborative ventures.

entry.title: Seed Potatoes (Crop Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations increase the fees payable to the Department of Agriculture and Rural Development in respect of the certification of seed potato crops arising under the Seed Potatoes Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001 (regulation 2 and the Schedule).

entry.title: The Designation of Bell College of Technology (Scotland) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order has the effect that on 1st August 2001 Bell College of Technology a further education college under the management of a Board of Management established under section 11(2) of the Further and Higher Education (Scotland) Act 1992, becomes a designated institution within the meaning of Part II of that Act.

entry.title: The Income Support and Jobseeker’s Allowance (Amounts for Persons in Residential Care and Nursing Homes) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 and the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996 by increasing the applicable amounts in those benefits in respect of those in residential care and nursing homes.

entry.title: The Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Scotland) Declaratory (No. 6) Amendment (No. 2) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order extends the infected area declared by the Foot and Mouth Disease (Scotland) Declaratory (No. 6) Order 2001 and subject to the restrictions therein.

entry.title: Gelatine (Intra-Community Trade) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Commission Decision 99/724/EC (O.J. No. L290, 12.11.99, p. 32) “the Commission Decision” so far as it relates to trade between Member States of the European Community and imposes new or changed obligations on the United Kingdom.

entry.title: The Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Scotland) Declaratory (No. 6) Amendment Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order extends the infected area declared by the Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Scotland) Declaratory (No. 6) Order 2001 and subject to the restrictions therein.

entry.title: The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Paralytic Shellfish Poisoning) (Orkney) (Scotland) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order, which forms part of Scots law only, contains emergency prohibitions restricting various activities in order to prevent human consumption of food rendered unsuitable for that purpose by virtue of shellfish having been affected by the toxin which causes paralytic shellfish poisoning in human beings.

entry.title: The Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Scotland) Declaratory (No. 7) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order imposes, with variations, the restrictions contained in Part III of the Foot-and-Mouth Disease Order 1983 (S.I. 1983/1950) within the infected area described in Schedule 1.
